appendix.title: Python Basics for E-Cell Users
appendix.para:
In Python, setting values of variables is a very simple job as in most other languages. For example, to set a string to a variable, use single quotes:
CLASSNAME = 'NuclearFusionProcess'

Numbers doesn't need the quotation:
FOOVAR = 3.11

To set a multiple line string, use triple quotes:
DESCRIPTION = ''' some multi-line description. '''
